intro: Sphaeralcea ambigua subsp. rosacea, commonly known as the pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is part of the Malvaceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
